_header: He that it rueth he rueth full sore
Note:
Based on Qui tetigit, tetigit … which precedes it; for an example of the Latin occuring separately, see James (1912)
XJames, Montague Rhodes. A Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge. Cambridge: at the UP, 1912, 2.193, and Walther (1963)
XWalther, Hans. Proverbia sententiaque latinitatis medii aevi. 6 vols. Göttingen, 1963-69, no. 24858.
_description: Repent and amend thy life (4 lines, aabb), a tag in the Fasciculus morum

Bod410.Transcription:
He þat þe thorgh smote he smote fulsoreAmende þi lyf
                    And synne nomoreLest he of eft so smyte þeþat þu be war
                    I rede þe het do

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
he þat hem Ruyth he ruþt ful soreAmende thi lif an synno
                    morelest he ofte so ruus yeþat þou be war I rede
                    the
BodLauMis111.Note: Written as verse with rubric rhyme markers to right.

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
He þat the throgh smot he smot full soreA mende þi lyfe and
                    synne no moreleste he offte off smyte þeþat þu be ware
                    i rede the

BodRawC670.Transcription:
He þat hem reuen hoe reuen ful soreAmende þy lyf and synne
                    no moreLest he eft so ryue þeÞat þou be war I rede
                    þe
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 134.

OxfLinLat52.Transcription:
He þat hym rewith he rew full soreamend þi life and synne
                    no moreLest ȝe oft so rew theþat þou be ware I rede
                    þe

CamGon364.Transcription:
He þat hym reuthyd he rewe ful soreAmende þi lyf and synne
                    no morelesteȝe ofte so rewe theþat þu be war I rede
                    the

CamStJohn159.Transcription:
he þat hym ruthe he rueth full soreAmend þi lyfe &
                    synne no moreleste he oft so rue on þeþu be war I reyd
                    þe

he þat hym reweth hym rewe full soreAmende þi liȝf
                    & synne no morelest eft he so rewe on thethat þu be war I
                    rede the

he þat hem rewe he rewe ful soreamende jn lyue and syne

Spalding.Transcription:
He that to the he toche ful soreAmende thi lyfe and synne no
                    moreLest that he smyte thethat thowe be ware I rede the
